rationale: The segment mentions prices 'shot up' but this modifies prices, not a risk adjective.
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.

rationale: The segment uses the high-potency verb phrase 'shot up' to describe an economic impact (prices).
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.
